Package space.sunqian.common.io.file

Interface FileRef

public interface FileRef
This interface represents a file reference used to retrieve information and manipulate the file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default @Nonnull FileInputStream
    fileInputStream()
    Returns a new FileInputStream for reading the referenced file.
    default @Nonnull FileOutputStream
    fileOutputStream()
    Returns a new FileOutputStream for writing the referenced file in overwrite mode.

    Returns a new FileOutputStream for writing the referenced file in the specified mode.

    • getContentType

      @Nullable default @Nullable String getContentType() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns the content type of the referenced file. The return value is in form of MIME.
      Returns:
      the content type of the referenced file, or null if the content type cannot be determined
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • readString

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull String readString(@Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset) throws IORuntimeException
      Returns string from the referenced file with the specified charset.
      Parameters:
      charset - the specified charset
      Returns:
      a string from the referenced file with the specified charset
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • readLines

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull List<String> readLines() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns all lines from the referenced file with the CharsKit.defaultCharset(). This method recognizes the following as line separators:
      • '\r\n'
      • '\n'
      • '\r'
      Returns:
      all lines from the referenced file with the CharsKit.defaultCharset()
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • readLines

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull List<String> readLines(@Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset) throws IORuntimeException
      Returns all lines from the referenced file with the specified charset. This method recognizes the following as line separators:
      • '\r\n'
      • '\n'
      • '\r'
      Parameters:
      charset - the specified charset
      Returns:
      all lines from the referenced file with the specified charset
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • writeBytes

      default void writeBytes(byte @Nonnull [] bytes, OpenOption @Nonnull ... options) throws IORuntimeException
      Write bytes to the referenced file with the open options. If no option is specified, this method creates a new file or overwrites an existing file.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the bytes to write
      options - the open options
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • writeString

      default void writeString(@Nonnull @Nonnull String string, OpenOption @Nonnull ... options) throws IORuntimeException
      Write string to the referenced file with the CharsKit.defaultCharset() and open options. If no option is specified, this method creates a new file or overwrites an existing file.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to write
      options - the open options
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • writeString

      default void writeString(@Nonnull @Nonnull String string, Charset charset, OpenOption @Nonnull ... options) throws IORuntimeException
      Write string to the referenced file with the specified charset and open options. If no option is specified, this method creates a new file or overwrites an existing file.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to write
      charset - the specified charset
      options - the open options
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • fileInputStream

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull FileInputStream fileInputStream() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns a new FileInputStream for reading the referenced file.
      Returns:
      a new FileInputStream for reading the referenced file
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • fileOutputStream

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull FileOutputStream fileOutputStream() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns a new FileOutputStream for writing the referenced file in overwrite mode. In overwrite mode, the file's content will be overwritten starting from the beginning, and the file's length will be truncated or extended to the number of bytes actually written.
      Returns:
      a new FileOutputStream for writing the referenced file in overwrite mode
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • fileOutputStream

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull FileOutputStream fileOutputStream(boolean append) throws IORuntimeException
      Returns a new FileOutputStream for writing the referenced file in the specified mode.

      In overwrite mode, the file's content will be overwritten starting from the beginning, and the file's length will be truncated or extended to the number of bytes actually written. Otherwise in append mode, new bytes will be written starting at the end of the file, and the file's length will be extended by the number of bytes actually written.

      Parameters:
      append - true for append mode, false for overwrite mode
      Returns:
      a new FileOutputStream for writing the referenced file in the specified mode
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • newInputStream

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull InputStream newInputStream(@Nonnull @Nonnull OpenOption @Nonnull ... options) throws IORuntimeException
      Opens and returns a new InputStream for reading the referenced file. If no option is specified, this method opens the file for reading.

      This method is equivalent to Files.newInputStream(Path, OpenOption...).

      Parameters:
      options - options specifying how the file is opened
      Returns:
      a new InputStream for reading the referenced file
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • newOutputStream

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull OutputStream newOutputStream(@Nonnull @Nonnull OpenOption @Nonnull ... options) throws IORuntimeException
      Opens and returns a new OutputStream for writing the referenced file. If no option is specified, this method opens the file for writing, creating the file if it doesn't exist, or truncating file to 0 size if it exists.

      This method is equivalent to Files.newOutputStream(Path, OpenOption...).

      Parameters:
      options - options specifying how the file is opened
      Returns:
      a new OutputStream for writing the referenced file
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs

    • newFileChannel

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull FileChannel newFileChannel(@Nonnull @Nonnull OpenOption @Nonnull ... options) throws IORuntimeException
      Opens and returns a new FileChannel for operating the referenced file.

      This method is equivalent to FileChannel.open(Path, OpenOption...).

      Parameters:
      options - options specifying how the file is opened
      Returns:
      a new FileChannel for operating the referenced file
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if any error occurs
